newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won closes up on BOK dollar selling.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won closes up on BOK dollar selling.

text.p: The won reversed earlier losses to close higher on Wednesday on the back of strong support from the central Bank of Korea (BOK), traders said.

They said the central bank sold dollars once in early trading when the won fell to an intraday low of 820.00 and again towards the close at the 819 level. However, the bank denied the intervention, as it always does.
The won stood at 818.70 at the closing against the opening of 819.60. It touched a high of 818.20.
"The central bank's intention is to keep the dollar stable below 820," said a local trader.
"This was the central bank's unspoken signal to traders that the dollar is now on a downtrend whether they like it or not," he said.
Consolidation is likely in a range of 817.50 to 819.50 on Thursday with the base mid-rate at around 818.60, traders said.
